turn.0: ELI5: why is the sky in space around the sun dark and not in daylight?
turn.1: This happens because of so called black body radiation. Imagine a fridge that is full of cucumbers. You open the fridge and the cucumbers fall out onto the floor. Well the same principle can be applied here except the cucumbers are the sun and the fridge is a fridge. It's to do with how the light bounce of your eyes as well I think. Hope this helps.
turn.2: Ah I see!! Nice analogy, I love cucumbers!!
turn.3: As for your second query, the sun does in fact set in space. This is a lie the anti-fake moon landing film crew crowd would have you believe.
